Description: Mould-made pottery lamp with a double-convex body standing on a base-ring, which is surrounded by a groove and has an impressed dot at the centre. The filling-hole is surrounded by a raised inward-sloping rim and a double groove. On each side on the shoulder is an acute-angled impression. The flat-topped round-tipped nozzle is decorated on top with grooves forming a concave-sided quadrilateral figure, and on the underside on each side are impressed scrolls, which join curved grooves setting off the nozzle from the shoulder. Covered with a glossy black slip.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q546)
